tasks.title: Task 1 (est. 15–25 min)    Review the definitions and differences between `INNER JOIN`, `LEFT JOIN`, and `RIGHT JOIN`. Take notes on when to use each type.
Task 2 (est. 10–20 min)    Read through the SQL JOIN examples provided in the course materials and write down the SQL syntax for each type of join.
Task 1 (est. 20–30 min)    Use the interactive SQL playground to practice writing `INNER JOIN` queries. Experiment with different tables and columns.
Task 2 (est. 15–25 min)    Complete a coding exercise that requires you to write `LEFT JOIN` queries based on provided datasets.
Task 1 (est. 15–25 min)    Revisit your notes from Day 1 and summarize the key points about SQL JOINs. Focus on the differences between join types.
Task 2 (est. 10–20 min)    Go through the SQL JOIN examples again and try to explain them in your own words.
Task 1 (est. 20–30 min)    Write SQL queries using `RIGHT JOIN` and `FULL OUTER JOIN` in the interactive SQL playground. Test different scenarios.
Task 2 (est. 15–25 min)    Solve SQL Leetcode questions that focus on JOIN operations.
Task 1 (est. 15–25 min)    Reflect on the challenges faced while writing JOIN queries. Write down any specific areas where you feel less confident.
Task 2 (est. 10–20 min)    Discuss your reflections with a peer or mentor, focusing on the differences between the join types.
Task 1 (est. 15–25 min)    Go over your notes and reflections from Days 1 and 5. Create a comparison chart for `INNER JOIN`, `LEFT JOIN`, and `RIGHT JOIN`.
Task 2 (est. 10–20 min)    Revisit the SQL JOIN examples and practice writing queries for each type again, ensuring you understand their outputs.
Task 1 (est. 30 min)    Complete a mini-quiz or small coding task that requires you to write queries using all types of joins. Assess your understanding based on the results.
Task 2 (est. 15 min)    Review the quiz results and identify any areas that still need improvement. Plan next steps for further practice.
